basic.floral_language:
Asarina antirrhiniflora 
Floriography: vivid, innocence, beautiful
Asarina antirrhiniflora is an herb, named for the shape of goldfish-like flowers.
Asarina antirrhiniflora stems are erect and handsome, with lively and vivid shape. Flowers have distinct shape, like little goldfish, with various bright color, very popular. Suitable for flower beds or home.
Asarina antirrhiniflora likes ample sunshine, also resistant to half shade, in summer avoid direct sunlight. Blooms in June-October with a period of flower viewing 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period June-October, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate light, resistant to half shade, avoid strong direct light in summer
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in early summer, spring and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
